DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Pyruvic Transaminase Result Normal Range Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the normal range for the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis and mediate conversion of major intermediate metabolites, catalyzing reversible transamination between alanine and alpha-ketoglutarate to form pyruvate and glutamate.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Pyruvic Transaminase Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis and mediate conversion of major intermediate metabolites, catalyzing reversible transamination between alanine and alpha-ketoglutarate to form pyruvate and glutamate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Activity measured as a test of liver function, human Glutamic-Pyruvate Transaminases (Alanine Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Glutamic Pyruvic Transaminases mediate conversion of major intermediate metabolites, catalyzing reversible transamination between alanine and alpha-ketoglutarate to form pyruvate and glutamate. (NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Alanine aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-alanine to alpha-ketoglutarate forming pyruvate and L-glutamate.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to describe the normal range of a lab test.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):Range; the difference between the lowest and highest numerical values.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
